intro: Diplotaxis harra var. lagascana, commonly known as the desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and broccoli. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow leaves, and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
